result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J Bube was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  

No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents unless employed and approved by agent.  

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

SAFE program intake and follow through. 

AODA and follow through.  

DNA sample.  

Probation review hearings.

timeConds.notes: I&S to be used for rules violations
I&S MCJ to be used for rules violations

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick J Bube

records.addlTxt: Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- C.B.
Probation review hearing on December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  3:07 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CM439, 22CT20.  
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Jay Kronenwetter. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.
Atty Kronenwetter makes arguments re: State's request for no contact.  

22CM439>>State moves to AMEND Count 1 (Battery/Domestic Abuse) to Disorderly Conduct/DA under 947.01(1); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA: 

22CM439 Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY.  

22CT20 Count 1 (OWI 3rd)>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on 22CT20: SWH for 2 years probation; CONDITIONS:  45 days MCJ with huber privileges for work; no objection to EMP. 
 45 days to report.  Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 24 months.  24 months DL revocation with any administrative credit.  AODA and follow up.  $1,744.00 fine inclusive of costs; DNA sample/surcharge.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  NO bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents unless employed and approved by agent.  

COURT ORDERS on 22CM439:  SWH for 2 years probation; CONDITIONS:   Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  SAFE program intake and follow through. AODA and follow through.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents unless employed and approved by agent.  No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge.  30 days MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations.  10 hours community service I/S to be used for rules violations.  Probation review hearings.  

Probation review hearing (22CM439)>>12/16/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj:  3:25 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 23, 2022 at 10:55 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  8:39 a.m. 
INCLUDES 22CM439, 22CT20.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Jay Kronenwetter. 

Date and time set for JSH. 
Atty Kronenwetter states they dont have an agreement at this time; however does not feel jury trial is necessary.  Atty Kronenwetter requesting PTC out of court. 
ADA Coonen has no objection to remove JT.  

COURT sets PTC on 22CM439 for 8/23/22 at 10:55 a.m. 
COURT directs Atty Kronenwetter to set PTC on 22CT20 after Court. 

COURT removes JT. 

Adj:  8:42 a.m.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:07 a.m. 
INCLUDES 22CM439, 22CT20.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Jay Kronenwetter. 

Date and time set for FPT. 
Atty Kronenwetter states there is no agreement at this time; will continue to work on resolution.  
State has nothing to provide at this point. 

COURT continues dates as set. 

Adj:  9:08 a.m.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2022 at 01:50 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 7, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Jury status hearing on August 9, 2022 at 08:40 am.
Jury Trial on August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s):  C.J.B.  or residence.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve personal property from residence.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:25 pm. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears from MCJ, and by Attorney Jack Mathie.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY. 

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s):  C.J.B. or residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 

- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 715-574-0199
